Name: Sly Knight Seekers
Description:
Oops! The robber escaped into the town! The knights start seeking clues from the people of the town. Fortunately, the knights have got a lot of information. But it’s not complete and the knights are not satisfied. Now they try to grab more clues from each other!

The players have cards in their hands as clues on the robbery. Then, the players sort their hand cards into an ascending order. Now, the turn player plays one card face-up to another player, seeking an answer. If that player has the same card at the end of their hand, they must give it to the turn player along with the played card. So, the players start to detect the other hand cards from seeking clues.

If you have 2 or 3 players, it’s a competition to win.
If you have 4 players, it’s a two partnership game to win.
If you have 5 players, one player is solo, and the other four are two partnerships.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Julie & Chris Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Julie and Chris to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.


     Plastic Julie Miniature
     Plastic Chris Miniature
     Plastic Walker Miniature
     Julie and Chris Character Cards
     Felling Axe, Grenade, Police Vest, and UTAS-UTS-15 Equipment Cards
     Mantic Point


—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Treasure Hunters of Charlemagne: A Four Against Darkness Adventure
Description:
AD 790. The Roman Empire is a distant memory. Europe is gripped by endless warfare. In these desperate times arises King Charles of the Franks. Wishing to unite the lands, and so end the senseless slaughter, the King sent secret agents to find supernatural artefacts, like the fabled spear of destiny.

Many of these agents never return, perishing at the hands of weird, unknown beasts and unspeakable perils.

Historians would record that mighty battles forged the realm of King Charles, later known as Charlemagne. The truth instead is that brave parties of adventurers, the intrepid secret agents of the King, are the ones who secured the new empire.

—description from the publisher

Name: Elementabble
Description:
Elementabble is like a game of scrabble with a scientific twist.
The Players use tiles to form words on a gameboard, but instead of the Alphabet the tiles show the chemical elements of the periodic system.

Every Player draws 10 tiles and gets two "-273,15 °C" tiles. A new word has to cover one of two startingpoints on the board or use at least one element of a word already on the board or be separated by an absolute zero tile from a word on the board.
Some Elements can also be used as Joker, in that case you cannot get points from them.
The Player score points according to the atomic numbers or the atomic mass (e.g. if a Joker element is used as the element and not as Joker). There are Bonus Points for longer words.
There are 4 levels of difficulty.

The games Ends when one player reaches at least 1000 Points, no one made a new word for two rounds or a Player forms the word "Schluss" ("end").
The single player game ends at reaching 4500 Points or if the player exchanges three tiles in a row without forming a new word. The game is lost if the Player didn't reach 4500 Points.

Name: NAVY: Academy
Description:
Use cunning tactics and long-term strategies to defeat the enemy!
Naval Academy (aka Epic Naval Battles) invites 2 players to replay epic historical naval engagements of World War 2.

Through a series of scenarios, arranged to form campaigns, you can recreate some of the most famous battles of the Atlantic and Pacific theatres.

The basic game mechanics are focused around creating a sandbox, so that players can design their own campaigns and battles, trying to answer the eternal "what if?" questions about historical events.

The game consists of:
- a modular board depicting varied terrain (with open seas, islands, and coastlines included)
- two sets of detailed and functional fleet vessels and markers
- several decks of cards with rule explanations, in-game events, and special commands, used in different scenarios outlined in the rulebook
- the rulebook, which includes ready-to-play scenarios and sandbox rules for creating your own naval engagements.

Name: ¿Quién soy? Electrónico
Description:
Who am I? for adult players, new rules and with an electronic device ("palabrómetro" or "wordmeter").
You fix the electronic device around your forehead and push it. A name of a famous person will appear on it, but you can not see it. Then ask the other players yes-or-no questions to determine, "Who am I?"
You have a limited time, but if you guess corectly, push it again to play with another name, until the time is over.
Ask the right questions and combine them in just the right way, who gets more points will be the winner.

                                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Muy grande y con trompa ¿QUIÉN SOY? 
Nunca fue tan divertido tener tantas cosas en la cabeza.
Más grande que una moto, más ruidoso que un camión. Me asustan las hormigas y tengo un gran trompón ¿Quién soy? Es tu turno, tienes 90 segundos ¿acertarás esta vez?
Llega el “palabrómetro”, un generador electrónico de palabras que debes colocarte sobre la frente, él indicará a tus compañeros de partida qué personaje, película, animal o canción eres y mediante pistas tendrás que adivinarlo en un tiempo record. 
Formad dos o hasta cuatro equipos, apretad el palabrómetro  e intenta adivinar quién eres entre las más de 2000 palabras que presenta el juego: actores, personajes históricos, políticos… puedes ser cualquiera, ¡descúbrelo con las pistas que te dé tu equipo!

Name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Junkers Ju.87 B–2 "Stuka" Squadron Pack
Description:
The Junkers Ju.87 B–2, best known as “Stuka,” was a single engine German dive bomber, easily recognizable by its inverted gull wings and fixed undercarriage. The Stuka’s design included several innovative features, including automatic pull–up dive brakes and a famous siren, the Jericho–Trompete, which would unleash a morale crushing whine when diving. The Stuka was widely used with great success during the first period of the Battle of Britain, although it later showed its vulnerability against well–organized opposition.

Sturzkampfgeschwader 77
StG 77 spearheaded the German blitzkrieg in Poland and France, but suffered heavy losses of men and machines during the earliest part of the Battle of Britain, when it was used to raid on enemy shipping and islands.

Name: Park Smarts Adventures: Grand Canyon
Description:
Park Smarts Adventures: Grand Canyon is designed to be educational and teach the players about the highways and features in the Grand Canyon National Park.

The game requires players to move "magnetic maneuvering pieces" around a magnetic board (with 2 sides) which illustrates the sites and features of Grand Canyon National Park on both the North Rim and South Rim. The goal of the game is to visit the ten most popular features of the park first. Whoever visits all the sites first wins.

The game pieces include: bicycle, motor home, sport utility vehicle, convertible, and jeep.

Movement of the game pieces is determined by dice rolls.

There are 3 sections of learning question cards (15 questions in each) and a mystery deck of cards.

Information cards include the following:

     About the Animals & Plants - Blue
     Fun Things to Do - Purple
     Fun Facts to Know - Green
     Mystery Cards - Red


—description from the publisher

Name: Football Wooden Travel Game
Description: The Football Wooden Travel Game is a dice game that uses pegs on a solid wood board. The players roll 2 dice simultaneously and consult the board to see the outcome of the play. As in normal American Football, each player gets 3 downs before they have the option to go for it on 4th down or punt. The first to 28 points wins!

Name: Alfred the Great: The Ethandun Campaign, 878 AD (Volume 3)
Description:
After Alfred and Guthrum had arranged a truce at Exeter and with Guthrum retreating back into Mercia (Vol. 2). Alfred must have assumed that the West Saxons could once again to look forward to a prolonged period of peace. But within five months Guthrum had reinforced his army and on the twelfth night, while the Saxons celebrated there holy period, Guthrum and his Viking Allies launched a surprise attack at Alfred's Royal estate at Cippanhamm. Through good intelligence, good fortitude and/or plain good luck Alfred was able to escape and with a handful of followers made his way to the marshes of the Somerset Levels.
It is here in the most inhospitable of conditions of sea-flooded swamp that Alfred, with a handful of followers, was to make a seemingly impregnable fortress at Althelney. It was from that King Alfred was to launch a guerilla campaign against his Viking tormentors. Within five months the King's forces defeated the Viking Army of Guthrum in a pitched battle at Ethandun.
Though Alfred entered the marsh with a small number of loyal followers we also know that he was not completely without allies. Odda Ealdorman of Devonshire was protecting Athelney by controlling the River Perret from Cynuit Hillfort, and was to do battle there with the legendary Ubbe Lothbrok (son of Ragnar) Alfred also had the support of Ealdorman of Somerset, Aethelnoth, who had also been fighting the Vikings from the Somerset levels. Aethelnoth's support was in no doubt instrumental in helping Alfred regroup and plan his campaign to reclaim Wessex.
Not all of Alfred's Earls were as loyal as Odda and Aethelnoth, and in this game the Saxons of Wiltshire are in a state of civil war with their warriors split between loyalty for their King and a Saxon controlled Wessex. It is there that the treacherous Ealdorman, Wulfhere, gained control and sided with the Viking invaders.
The Viking strength was in their professional and aggressive soldiery skills. Their weaknesses were often in the re-supply of fighting men and the fact the West Saxons were fighting for their home.
Kings are of great importance in this series of games. When they are leading the warriors in combat your moral and thereby fighting ability is increased, without them weakened. Of course the loss of a King in battle can also mean the loss of your cause. However, in this era risks must be taken to take and hold the crown.
Sharpen your sword and pick up your shield for the call has gone out, 'the King is on the march'…………………

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Warrior Kings Campaign (High Flying Dice Games)

Name: Around the Farm
Description: Based on Eric Carle's best-selling book, players spend a fun-filled day Around the Farm helping baby animals find their way home. Help baby pigs locate the pigpen, baby ducks waddle to the pond, baby horses trot to the hayfield, and baby sheep back to their pasture. The game introduces children to counting and identifying baby and adult animals. Counting is especially fun as the players make animal sounds for each animal they move. Everyone wins in this cooperative game when each baby animal has been reunited with its adult animal!

Name: Spin Go Round!
Description:
Take a Spin with Vampirina in this exciting twist on bingo! Spin to see where you can play. Match the color, pattern, shape or character. If you get Spin Go Round, everyone switches spinners! You never know when the game will take a batty turn!

—description from the publisher

Name: Evil High Priest: Blood Ceremony
Description: The Blood Ceremony Expansion contains 4 new Cult boards (Tcho-Tcho, Sleeper, Opener of the Way and Crawling Chaos), 1 Tcho-Tcho Growth Counter, 4 Crawling Chaos Avatar Cards, 12 Monster Cards, 10 Investigator Cards and 10 Priest Cards.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Dominion Faction Pack
Description: The Dominion Faction Pack is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Dominion faction: a Jem'Hadar battleship, a Jem'Hadar battle cruiser, and two Jem'Hadar attack ships..  Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 27 cards.  Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Romulan Faction Pack
Description: The Romulan Faction Pack is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Romulan faction: a Valdore class, a D'deridex class, a scout vessel and a science vessel.  Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 26 cards.  Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Captain's Chair Resource
Description:
The Captain's Chair Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Chronological Chaos" Organized Play Event.

When used, it can only be assigned to a ship that has a Captain with a printed Captain Skill of 5 or higher.

During the activation phase, once per round, the ship to which it is assigned may remove a disabled token from one of it's cards if it performed a non-Red maneuver.

It is considered a resource and costs 3 squadron points.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Frontline Retrofit Resource
Description:
The Frontline Retrofit Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Resource Rumble" Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs 3 Squadron Points.

When using this resource, it may only be assigned to a ship that has a printed Hull Value of 3 or less.  The assigned ship increases it's Shield Value and Captain Skill by 1 each, and adds an additional Tech slot to it's Upgrade Bar.

Name: The Darkness Comes
Description:
A cooperative adventure game set in the 16bit era. Explore, upgrade and fight back. Games last between 10-40 min depending on the scenario. All you need is 4 dice or use a dice app (many of which can be found for free). The game contains some great little mechanics which include, random placed map tiles, allowing for a different experience each game. The random placement system (RPS) tells you where certain things in the game will appear. Enemies will move around and use special abilities triggered by dice combinations. Light fires to craft potions, by collecting items found in the world you explore. Battle great monsters and bring light into darkness!

—description from the designer

Name: Crazy Neighbors
Description:
Crazy Neighbors is a humorous game, where the players assume the roles of residents in a suburban neighborhood populated by a cast of crazy stereotypes.

Each player belongs to one of four exaggerated demographic groups, the Hippies, the Rednecks, the Culture Snobs or the Moneybags. The people belonging to the different groups obviously cannot stand each other, and the goal of the game is to make sure that your preferred type of people move in to your neighborhood, and that the properties surrounding your opponents are populated by people they dislike. Meanwhile you can also upgrade your own property and bring all kinds of misfortune to your opponents.

The game plays with all kinds of stereotypes in a tongue-in-cheek manner. For the duration of the game, each player will identify with their own demographic and try to be as outrageously mean as possible to her opponents.

The large cast of neighbors are represented by cards with individual abilities and descriptions, each illustrated by the gifted artist Erik Ødegaard.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wizards and Warzones: Trading Card Game
Description:
The way the game works is each player has a deck of 40~60 cards, after shuffling you draw 6 cards from the deck, decide who goes first, etc. then each player starts with 30 Loyalty (its like your Life Points) and 10 resources (just as important as Loyalty). Each player will spend their resources to play creatures to attack their opponents with and defend their Base (their side of the field), and play powerful spells, weapons, and artifacts to power up their creatures! Be careful though, because you might trigger an opponents Event card! (It's like an instant or a trap card) and then you might get set back as a result! Plan carefully as you set up your Terrain cards (Their like lands and field cards) to bolster your creatures defenses (by giving them a safe place to hide) and be prepared when you play your Epics (similar to legendary artifacts) because though they may greatly aid your creatures, one slip up and it could be stolen from you, if that happens 3 times you lose the game! Oh and don't forget to pay attention to the placement of your creatures to (because it matters big time!) If your not careful you might leave your weakest creature on the Front Lines (where it can be attacked) when it should have stayed in your Base (where its more safe)

—description from the designer

Name: Sly
Description:
The Triade de Diamants, three identical diamonds, having broken the laws of nature, have become a marvel gracing the greatest museums on earth. Until now...

Jack Sly is a diamond thief attempting to become a legend by collecting all three diamonds. Gregory Lestrade III, descendant of Scotland Yard's Inspector Lestrade, is determined to create his own legacy, by bringing the master thief to justice.

In Sly, a puzzle card game for 1-2 players, Sly sneaks across the cards representing three museums, endeavoring to manipulate them to his advantage, uses the tricks of the trade to snatch the diamonds, and attempts to escape before the police can catch up with him. Will you get away, or wind up imprisoned? If you can't take the heat, you're not Jack Sly.

—description from the designer

Name: Beowulf Legends: Terror at Heorot
Description:
Beowulf Legends: Terror at Heorot is a fast-paced and exciting card-drafting game for 2 to 5 players.

Players take on the roles of loyal Thanes to the good King Hrothgar, carousing in the vast and fabulous Mead Hall of Heorot, but powerless to defeat the terrible monster Grendel who nightly attacks their feasting — until a fearless warrior from Geatland arrives to save them: a hero named Beowulf.

The game takes place over four rounds, each representing one night of feasting. During the feasts, players draft cards to collect valuable gold coins and healing balms, receive the honour of Heorot, and sing songs to the glory of Hrothgar in the hope of being rewarded with one of his gifts.

At the end of each feast the next Grendel and Feast cards are revealed to determine who Grendel attacks, inflicting 'scratches' on one or more of the players.

After the fourth feast, Beowulf arrives and defeats the monster Grendel, and Hrothgar rewards Beowulf for finally ridding Heorot of Grendel’s terror, but Beowulf is generous, and shares these gifts with the players who he considers to be the most honourable.

But, before the true hero of Heorot can be celebrated, the player who suffered the most at Grendel’s terrible hand is laid to rest by his comrades, and his gold coins buried with him.

The surviving player with the most gold coins is celebrated as a true hero of the Danes — by Beowulf, Hrothgar and everyone at Heorot!

—description from the designer

Name: Anna's Roundtable: Fire Emblem Board Game – Siege mode expansion
Description:
New game mode introducing asymmetric 1v1 gameplay.

One player creates a party of 5 units, selecting 1 unit as their "Lord" unit, while the other player takes control of an army of generic units, having up to 8 generic units deployed at any given time. (Out of a total of 18 different generic unit options.)

The match ends once the defending player's Lord unit is defeated, and the two players switch sides.

The player who defeats the most generic units as the defender wins!

Total gameplay time lasts around 30 to 45 minutes.

—description from the designer

Name: Divine Right: Ambassador Personality Cards and Siege Train Counters
Description:
Two sets of variant components for Divine Right, and accompanying rules articles by Jon Freeman, published in issue 34 of The Dragon magazine (February, 1980).

The 12 ambassador cards give names and diverse personalities to the ambassadors in Divine Right. Each player receives an ambassador personality card at the start of the game. The cards specify various advantages and disadvantages (including die-roll modifiers) for each ambassador.

The 12 siege train counters are attributed to Freeman's gaming group, the White Mountain Gamers of Washington state. In addition to the rules for the use of the siege train counters, a couple of other variations for the Divine Right siege rules are proposed.

Both sets of variant components are printed on a single cardstock sheet bound between pages 6 and 7 of the magazine.

The Dragon #34 referred to itself as "the Divine Right issue", as it also contained a number of other articles about the game, including:


     Designer Glenn Rahman's suggested changes to the 1979 edition published by TSR
     The official second edition rules changes from the TSR design department
     Tom Wham's proposed optional rules that did not make it into the published game
     Two articles suggesting a number of gameplay variants


— User Summary

Name: The Pantheon: The Age of Quest
Description:
The Pantheon: The Age of Quest is a 2-4 player fantasy card game where Deities and Creatures from every bloodline wage war in epic fashion. Each player is presented with a 78 card pre-constructed deck designed to maximize the full potential of your chosen faction.

Engage your opponents in awesome table-top game play where you control the fate of God's in head-to-head combat.

Name: The Dwarf (fan expansion for Dragon's Hoard)
Description:
The Dwarf is an action card who aloud you to steal one treasure already in game from another player.

The dwarf is interesting only by gems and gold so they don't steal wishing tree or prince/princess (treasure 7-8).

A treasure in a lair is protected from Dwarf.

A Dwarf can be stop by a dragon card.

A Dwarf with a Wizard is unstoppable.

The unicorn protect from the dwarf.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aventuria: Arsenal of Heroes
Description:
Arbosh had driven Carolan into a corner and gotten ready to take him out with a huge blow of his Ox-Herd when he realized to his surprise that he wasn’t holding the weapon in his hand. “Are you looking for this?” said Carolan, triumphantly raising the stolen weapon over his head.

“You disgusting little thief!” Arbosh spat out and reached into his backpack with an annoyed grunt...and pulled out another Ox-Herd from it! “Luckily, I always go with two of them these days,” he added with a grim smile. “Let’s see which of us is better at wielding it!”

Surprise your opponents with completely new decks! Arsenal of Heroes is a duel expansion for Aventuria - the Adventure Card Game, dedicated to deck customization and tournament play. It includes rules for running tournaments, deck strategies, and extra cards to fill out your Base Set so that you have at least two of every card!

"Aventuria - Duellerweiterung Arsenal der Helden"
Arbosch hatte Carolan in die Ecke gedrängt, holte zu einem gewaltigen Schlag mit seiner Ochsenherde aus - und stellte überrascht fest, dass er das gute Stück nicht mehr in der Hand hielt. „Suchst du das hier?“, sagte Carolan, die erbeutete Waffe triumphierend in die Höhe gereckt. „Du widerlicher kleiner Dieb!“, spuckte Arbosch aus, griff mit einem ärgerlichen Grunzen in seinen Rucksack ... und zog eine weitere Ochsenherde hervor! „Zum Glück habe ich jetzt immer zwei dabei“, fügte er mit einem grimmigen Lächeln hinzu. „Mal sehen, wer von uns besser damit umgehen kann!“

Überrasche deine Gegner mit völlig neuen Decks! Arsenal der Helden ist eine Duellerweiterung für Aventuria - Das Abenteuerkartenspiel, die dir genug Karten zur Verfügung stellt, um alle denkbaren Deck-Kombinationen aus der Grundbox zu spielen.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Se te ve el plumero
Description:
Party game about personal questions.
The cards show characteristics or traits of a person, about physical, psychological or social questions - For example: To be a successful business-man/woman, to have a wonderful ass, to be the best friend in the room, etc.
You must use your money to bid for the cards you want to fit your objectives.
—user summary

El juego más divertido entre amigos 
¿Cuánto pagarías por conseguir tus deseos?
¡¡No pararéis de reír!!
Un divertido juego en el que no pararéis de reír en tus reuniones con amigos, que, además, os aportará un mensaje apasionante. Fórjate una nueva vida, una nueva personalidad, comprando por medio de una ¡divertida subasta! virtudes, capacidades, rasgos que sacarán a relucir vuestras preferencias. ¡Desenmascararos, veros los Plumeros!, te sorprenderás de las preferencias de tus amigos. Cuánto pagarías por. ¿Tener un culo imponente?, ¿Heredar una gran fortuna? ¿Ser el más sexy de la discoteca? ¿Ser un empresario de éxito? . ¿Seguimos? El juego tiene un final sorprendete ¡¡descúbrelo!!
—description from the publisher

Name: Wing Leader: Supremacy C3i #30 Scenarios
Description:
Two scenarios and 20 counters for Wing Leader: Supremacy 1943-1945, included in C3i Magazine, Issue #30.

Scenario 1 - Here Comes the Beast, Rabaul, 11 November 1943.

Scenario 2 - Operation Meridian, Sumatra, 24 January 1945.

Name: Dados de fútbol
Description:
Football dice.
Play soccer with 4 dice.
You can throw your dice 3 times and choose wich one to get or to reroll. You need results with the color of your team, and one die with corner, penalty or goal symbol. After 3 throws, your turn is over.
You must take notes fo the scorings. The player who scores most goals will be the winner.

                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Juega al fútbol con 4 dados.
Con toda la emoción del fútbol. Goles, penaltis, córners y faltas.
Juega con tus amigos y amigas creando vuestras propias ligas. Es muy divertido. No podrás parar de jugar. Se venden con una bolsita para que se puedan llevar cómodamente a cualquier parte y no se pierdan.

Name: Dados de baloncesto
Description:
Basketball dice.
Play basketball with 4 dice. You can throw your dice 3 times and choose wich one to get or to reroll. You need results with the color of your team, and one die with double or triple basket symbol. After 3 throws, your turn is over.
You must take notes of the scoring.
After a number of rounds, the player who scores most points will be the winner.

                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Juega al baloncesto con 4 dados
Con toda la emoción del baloncesto. Canastas, triples,  faltas y tiros libres.
Juega con tus amigos y amigas creando vuestras propias ligas. Es muy divertido. No podrás parar de jugar. Se venden con una bolsita para que se puedan llevar cómodamente a cualquier parte y no se pierdan.

Name: Dados de golf
Description:
Golf dice.
Play golf with 5 dice.
One die shows the hole objective. You can throw your dice and choose wich one to get or to reroll. You need to reach the distance shown on the objective die, and a blue or green flag depending of the objective. When you reach the objective, you compare your number of throws with the par of the hole and score points consequently.
You must take notes fo the scorings. The player who scores less points will be the winner.

                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Juega un partido de golf con 5 dados
Con toda la emoción de un partido de golf. Lanzamientos, distancias, hoyos, pares, birdies y bogeys.
Juega con tus amigos y amigas creando vuestros propios partidos. Es muy divertido. No podrás parar de jugar. Se venden con una bolsita para que se puedan llevar cómodamente a cualquier parte y no se pierdan.

Name: Cha-cha-boo!!
Description:
Cha Cha Boo is a card game that combines strategy, chance and balance. During their go, each player must decide how to distribute the different monsters that are dealt, among the players. They must place the cards, forming a steady row without any of them falling. The player that gets the most monsters is the winner, but don't forget that some monsters can also make you lose points.


                                                                                                            
                                                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                
                                                                                            
                                                                                        
                                                                                    
                                                                                
                                                                            
                                                                        
                                                                    
                                                                
                                                            
                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Coloca en equilibrio las divertidas cartas de monstruos marchosos.

Name: Co-Co Pio
Description:
Co co pio is a card game in which the aim is to be the first to get your hens to have three chicks.
Each player must play thir cards:
- to protect their farm with the dog or the incubator
- make it grow with eggs or chicks
- or to pester your opponents' farms with magpies, foxes, worms, cats, ...

Name: Hollywood Haiku: a Game of Film Trivia and Bad Poetry – Classics
Description:
Movie trivia with an element of area control - the sooner you answer the better! Correct answers always rewarded. Clues to over 1,100 films. For 2-6 players/teams. Three different versions geared to film fans of different ages: Classics, Silver Screen, and Millenium.

Mechanics: Read clues to the other players. Each clue is written as a haiku. Players write answers on white boards – once the white board is placed on the game board there’s no changing your answer.  The quicker you can answer correctly the better off you are. Place markers on one of the seven Hollywood stars on the board, each representing a different film category (each version includes action/adventure, comedy, drama, sci-fi, horror & suspense, fantasy; and one other that differs in each version). Or ,draw Bonus Objective cards for a chance to earn even more points for reaching goals such as having the most markers in a given category or for having markers in all the categories. 
Game ends as soon as any player places 17 markers. Players get one point for each marker placed, and additional points for accomplishing Bonus Objectives.

—description from the designer

Name: Trumpolicy
Description:
WHAT KIND OF A SOCIETY DO YOU WANT?

Enjoy a friendly board game while having stimulating conversation on the most relevant issues of the day. The game may be played with individual competitors or as two competing teams (2 or 3 players per team). Players or teams roll the dice to move around the board to try to secure a set of social policies with assigned values.

Gameplay: Each player starts with 100 political chits and earns more when they visit the White House. They may also use their political chits by placing a deposit on those policies they wish to prevent others from securing. The team format is set up as Democratic versus Republican policies, with each team having to secure the requisite value of their party’s policies (blue versus red squares) in order to win the game. As players move around the board they may draw Twitter cards which may adjust their political chit totals or send them to different policy squares or to the media scrum or senate hearings squares which might impede their progress.

Objective: The first player or team to secure the requisite value of policies wins the game.

Dare to play this game with your family and friends and find out what they really think!

—description from the publisher

Name: La Guerre-Eclair
Description:
This hidden set-up war game is an unusual WWII adaptation of the classic L'Attaque. What makes it most unusual is that the rules are dated 11/44, which means it must have been one of the first French games published after the liberation.

This is a more complex game than L'Attaque or its successor Stratego. Its name translates as "The Lightning War" (or Blitzkrieg), and this is reflected in the mix of pieces.

Whereas L'Attaque and its successor Stratego simply used numerically ranked pieces, this game includes a host of WWII-era innovations as well, with pieces representing parachutists, bombers, anti-aircraft guns, delayed-action bombs, flying bombs and a tanker-truck that must survive to keep the bombers flying. Missing from the mix is any kind of armored unit, but there are "magnetic fences" that somehow disable the engines of aeroplanes.

Movement and combat is much more flexible than in the basic L'Attaque. Pieces may move in any direction, including diagonally, and may attack any piece orthogonally adjacent. To win, players must capture both the opponent's flag and its "secret plan".

Name: Fallen Land: Gen Con 2017 Promo Cards
Description:
Set of 4 promo cards given out at Gen Con 2017.

Mission card - "Tanked" 
Mountain card - "Outrider's Trading Post"
Spoils card - "Cosplay Regalia" 
Action card - "Convention or Bust"

Name: Munchkin Panic: Potion of Mwahahaha! Promo Card
Description:
Promo treasure card "Potion of Mwahahaha!"

Card text: 
"Play at any time to destroy a Tower.  
Keep this card with your slain Monsters and add 5 to your score"

Name: Gank
Description:
Gank is what a MOBA video game looks like when you convert it for the tabletop with euro-design. You don't push around a hundred miniatures on a map with a hundred grid spaces. You don't see dozens of trooper miniatures scattered across the battlefield on the various lanes.

What you do see, are still the iconic 3 lanes that each leads to both your base and your opponent's. But these are very simplified and there are only 7 spaces on each of these lanes, which really act more as tracks. There are no actual soldier miniatures, but there is a frontline marker that represents the point at which each lane is being contested.

It is deceptively simple! You just play down 1 of 5 Heroes (each hero taking unique roles - Carry, DPS, Utility, Tank, Support) from your hand, pick action cards from a pyramid that represent what the hero does that turn, and finally cast skills and spells from that hero. It is then your opponent's turn. Rinse and repeat until either one of the lanes has all towers destroyed and gets overrun by the opposing side, or one of the teams' morale drops to zero from having too many hero deaths, or a team manages to collect all Celestium crystals first and win immediately.

To ensure this is the RIGHT game for you, do not go into it thinking that it is that simple or that it's a casual gateway game. Gank is intended for gamers who are already in the hobby for some time. This is a pretty HEAVY game in every sense of the word, and you have to watch for multiple things like which action cards NOT to take so the opponent does not have options opened up for them, what cards to deny them by picking those yourself (even if you don't really need them) and even looking for big combos between heroes!

As for Hero miniatures, you have an option to make your game even more beautiful and get 3D representatives of your Heroes, or you can simply choose to use the more affordable alternative where Heroes are just cards in your hand. In the event you have the luxury of the premium miniatures, they are no mere decorations. You will use the miniatures heavily during the game as representatives of the Heroes being played out, their sequence and order etc.

As mentioned earlier, the full action of the battle is represented by a pyramid-shaped layout of cards that you and your opponents take turns to pick cards from - starting from the bottom row. There are 4 types of cards, namely Farming, Attacking, Pushing and Treasure cards. Depending on the role of the Hero played forth, you will also pick cards with different rulesets. For example, the Tank can only take 1 card but does not take any damage from Farming cards (which others normally do). The Carry allows you to take 1 card, and then 1 more directly above it (this makes your Carry the most powerful role since it can access the higher tier cards faster) or the Utility Hero which takes any 2 cards in the same row, as long as they are different types. Sometimes on the cards, there are Celestium crystals to be collected, or materials to be farmed (usually from Farming cards) where you can later combine with Item Recipes to create powerful equipment for your Heroes. Gold and Mana are also acquired from these very action cards.

Each Hero you play generally has 2 skills, one of which requires mana to perform. There is a 3rd 'Ultimate' skill that unlocks for them when they level up (there's only 2 levels in the game, so each Hero can only level up once)

The game is played in Rounds, with each ending when the top card on the pyramid is taken. At the end of each round, there is a Planning phase. Players will spend their Gold to manipulate the battlefield. Because buying of strategy cards are secretive, players will inevitably experience exciting mind games. Will they buy card A? Should you buy card B to prepare for a counter?

This game also features a 4 player mode of 2v2 where each player controls 4 heroes instead of 5, making it 8 heroes per team instead of the usual 5. The card pool is also larger by 5 cards per round, but all else stays the same and Gold, Materials and Crystals are shared in a team.

Name: Neuro Match
Description:
Pairs of cards are laid out on the table. One card in each pair shows a body movement/gesture and a phrase, the other one a letter or number. Some of these pairs are open, some are concealed after everyone had a look at them. During the game, additional pairs are added.
Players take turns flipping open cards from a personal pile of cards. When a letter or number appears that is in one of the pairs, everyone has to either do the gesture or say the phrase or both (depending on the agreed difficulty level) on the matching card. The last player to do this has to take all the open cards. The first player to get rid of all their cards is the winner.

Name: The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Mexico
Description:
The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Mexico is a promotional card for The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire, originally intended for retailers. It was also made available as a stretch reward for Kickstarter backers of Manhattan Project 2: Minutes to Midnight.

Whoever chooses to play Mexico at the start receives 3 oil, 1 plastic and 1 steel. To move up 1 space on the United Nations track, the player will need to give up 1 oil and 1 plastic.

Name: Lotus
Description:
Lotus is a Go-like game where captured pieces swap colors. The goal is to claim the most territory -- pieces and any empty points they surround. It's played on the 72 intersections flower-shaped board, just like the better known, Kensington.

Instead of placing a piece on his turn, a player can pull the point track marker one step in his direction. This score is added to the territory count at the end.

Name: Monster Lands: Heavy Weapons & 5th Player
Description:
This expansion introduces new versatile and powerful components into the game, the Heavy Weapons. They have multiple activations and, unlike Traps and Defense tokens, can be brought home from battle if not used. They may allow your Mercenary to hide behind them, if activating their Defense value, or to use their immense fire power to blast Monsters out of the way or to destroy that roadblock that lets you conquer a Land.

Coupled with the Heavy Weapons come the Mercenaries of the Forge Affinity. Use them by replacing those of another Affinity of choice or by adding them if you play a 5-player game. These Mercenaries have long been fiddling with the weapons as if they were pets, lets not part them from their treasures.

Name: ReaverQuest
Description:
In a far off world of Swords and Sorcery the cyclopean Tower of Ravingspire looms over a mystic battlefield. Mighty warriors of the realm, known as Reavers, sojourn to this desolate valley to battle for dominance in an annual combat known as the Reaverquest. These warriors must fight with all their skill and cunning, as the seeping magic of the Tower may alter the very battlefield they fight on at a moment’s notice!

Reaverquest is a fast-paced card battle game of brawling and swordplay set in the Sword and Sorcery world of Ravingspire. For 2-3 Players.

Reaverquest consists of 30 Fight cards, 10 Rage cards, 9 Battlefield cards, and 3 Reaver Hero cards. Each Player chooses a specific Reaver to represent them in the combat, and uses that Hero card to track their health. Six of the ten Rage cards are randomly chosen and dealt into the deck of Fight cards, making the Rage dynamics of each game slightly different. The Battlefield cards are set aside as a separate deck near the gameplay area.

Each Player is dealt a hand of six cards from a communal Fight deck that contains various values of Attack, Riposte, and Deflect cards, all with values ranging from 1-10. The deck also contains six of the ten Rage cards, which have various effects in battle. This hand is then used to combat your opponent, with the goal of reducing your opponent’s health to zero. Health is known as Vigor, and is tracked by rotating your Hero card so your current value is facing you.

Each time a Player plays an ATTACK card a new Battle begins, and their opponent may DEFLECT the damage (partially blocking the Attack or sending the excess damage toward another Player), RIPOSTE the damage (partially blocking the Attack or returning the excess damage back toward the Attacker), or they may use one of the rare RAGE cards that have various effects. Ripostes may be countered back and forth until one of the Reavers takes damage, at which time that Battle ends.

Initiative for each Battle (including the decision of which Attack card to play and who to send it toward) goes to the Player who did not play the last card in the previous Battle. Sometimes it can be more advantageous to take damage from the current Battle rather than block it so as to claim Initiative for the next Battle!

If a defender ever uses a DEFLECT card to cause the value of the Battle to equal exactly zero, then they have performed a Perfect Parry. This kind of combat prowess so near the otherworldly Tower of Ravingspire causes a dimensional shift in the Battlefield. That defender draws a Battlefield card and benefits from the Perfect Parry effect listed in yellow on the card, which have various effects such as healing or drawing extra Fight cards. They then place that Battlefield card next to the gameplay area and all Players are now subject to the changes to the game listed in white on the card until that Battlefield is replaced. Where previously they may have been fighting in the Reaver Valley, where all Attack cards gain +1 value, suddenly they may find themselves battling within the Thief’s Maze, where any Deflect cards may be played as Ripostes!

The game is played in a series of Rounds. A Round ends when no Player can play an Attack card, or one Player takes full damage from an Attack without defending in any way. When a Round ends any remaining cards in the Players’ hands are discarded, as are any persistent Rage card effects on their Reaver. A new hand of cards is dealt to each Player and a new Round begins. The Dealer for the new Round rotates counterclockwise, and the Player to the Dealer’s left has Initiative at the beginning of the new Round.

The ultimate goal of Reaverquest is to reduce your opponents’ Vigor to zero, forcing them to submit to your rule and allowing you to claim the title of Vorpal Reaver.

—description from the publisher

Name: Øisteins Drodlespill
Description:
Game teaching kids to draw. A player draws a card, tries to draw it, and the other players try to guess what it is. 
—User summary

Name: Stakkerz
Description:
Stakkerz is a fast-paced dexterity game of precise placement and steady nerves. Players take turns "stakking" chips on a totem, with a goal of keeping the totem standing, but also attempting to sabotage the next player by making the stakk as unstable as possible! Stakkerz is playable by all age groups, with simple rules, sturdy components, and game times of less than 10 minutes.

www.Stakkerz.com is the official website, and Stakkerz is on Facebook as well as Instagram.

Name: Joking Hazard: Deck Enhancement #2
Description:
You wanted more cards, and we made them! Our second deck enhancement adds 100 BRAND NEW CARDS to Joking Hazard, the offensive card game from Cyanide & Happiness. Simply mix them into your Joking Hazard deck, and enjoy.

These comic panels are dirtier and weirder than ever. Mix them in and take your game to new heights.
This is an expansion pack! It requires Joking Hazard to play.
High quality cards written by low quality people.
A lot of the cards have butts on them. Perhaps too many
This expansion created entirely without help from the Russians

Name: Cube Conundrum
Description:
Cube Conundrum is a simple-to-learn game that can be played in about 10-15 minutes but is designed to be extremely flexible and provide a different game every time, depending on how you set up the board.

Players use action cards to move their cubes from start to finish along a hexagonal path. The cards send each cube forward or backward one space on every turn. Depending on the cards in your hand, you may have no choice but to help your fellow players. However, chances are good they'll be repaying you in the future.

Every card affects every player on every turn. Choose Wisely!

The hexagonal path includes advanced/harder gameplay options for those looking for a longer game with some twists and turns. While strategy does play a role in this game, there is an equal element of luck-of-the-draw as well.

—description from the publisher

Name: Supernatural Save Your Souls
Description:
Fans of the TV hit Supernatural know that Sam and Dean abide by certain rules to keep themselves safe. One of said rules is keeping innocent people out of harm’s way—but rules were meant to be broken.

The Winchesters finally got a Supernatural card game, appropriately titled Save Your Souls. It breaks all the rules the brothers strictly obeyed…or so you thought!

Sam and Dean Winchester need your help. Join them on a card game journey to save innocent lives. Ok, well mostly, the goal is to save your own.

In this game of chance, you’re paired with one of the series’ iconic hunters, an angel, or even the King of Hell himself. Be careful! You must choose your cards wisely, or you could end up losing your soul.

—description from the publisher

Name: Evil High Priest: The Dark Ritual
Description:
The Dark Ritual Stretch Goal box is included in the original Kickstarter Dunwich-pledge. It includes rewards for the base game as well as the Blood Ceremony expansion.

Thus far it contains:

     3 Monster cards
     Priest card



     Ancient Cult Board
     22 Atomic Resource Tokens
     6 Three-value Atomic Resource Tokens



     Windwalker Cult Board
     3 Glacier cards (Wendigo, the Gnoph-Keh, and Rhan-Tegoth)

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Onslaught 3 Stretch Goal Box
Description:
Stretch goal rewards for the Onslaught 3 Kickstarter campaign

Components:

     Omega Master Rulebook, Onslaught 3 edition
     'Glow in the Dark' Gate
     Maroon H. P. Lovecraft 1st Player Marker (holding a lantern)
     Maroon Asenath Waite 1st Player Marker
     New Rules for Worms of Ghroth
     Eradication 1st Player Marker + New Rules (loyalty card)
     Ancients Brain Cylinders
     Ancients Colored Gate
     Ancients High Priest
     Errata spellbooks for Great Cthulhu and Tcho-Tcho
     8 Investigator Miniatures (Victor Steele, Amelia Azevedo, Tarang, Cindrew Putorius, John Dark, Naomi Johnson, Moose Kowalski, and Hannah Hazard) and their Loyalty cards
     9 Neutral Grey Acolytes (1 for each existing faction)


The Moose Kowalski sculpt is credited to "Liya International". Victor Steele, Amelia Azevedo, Cindrew Putorius, and Naomi Johnson are credited to "Game Chain". Tarang, John Dark, and Hannah Hazard are credited to "Tidal 4".

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Ancients
Description:
The Ancients Faction are a human-oriented faction, and are particularly unusual, because they don’t have their own Great Old One. They have to be extremely sensitive to the other players, and must engage in diplomacy and negotations to an extent previously unknown in Cthulhu Wars.

Like Yellow Sign, you need to travel across the world. In your case, this is to build Cathedrals in the same areas marked with Symbols as Yellow Sign (though you also have to build one Cathedral in an unmarked area). Fortunately, you have an ace up your sleeve – other factions often rather like to share their areas with a Cathedral. But you can’t always rely on this, and you lack the punch of Yellow Sign’s undead army.

Like most factions, each of your creatures has a spellbook dedicated to it. Unlike every other faction, these spellbooks actually make your creature inferior in some way! However, they’re still worth getting for two reasons. First, they make the creature MUCH less expensive, and thus let you have a good combat punch (which you’ll need). Second, you can’t win the game without all six spellbooks!

Your special faction ability is Dematerialization, and is useful in movement. Each Doom phase, select one area in which you have units. Move any or all of those units to one other selected area, anywhere on the map. In play, you’ll find this useful not only for planned attacks, but also for building your Cathedrals.

—description from the publisher

The Cathedral, Un-men, Reanimated, and Yothan sculpts are credited to "Tidal 4".

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Shaggai Map Expansion
Description:
This new map represents the planet of Shaggai, annihilated centuries ago. It is, of course, the original home of the Insects from Shaggai (who made their appearance in Onslaught Two). In those days, the horrendous hellworld Ghroth wandered too near Shaggai, and initiated the process that resulted in Shaggai’s complete destruction. The map of course is set during the time of Shaggai’s eradication, which is represented by the Worms of Ghroth – horrendous tools of woe which spread across the surface, leaving oblivion in their wake.

The map is divided into hex-shaped areas, representing the insectile nature of the world’s native inhabitants. Some are oceans, other land, and the game starts with a single Worm of Ghroth – a harbinger of ruin.

As the game progresses, each Doom phase existing Worms of Ghroth tend to annihilate the areas they are on, and new Worms are spawned. Eradicated areas actually generate power, and can even benefit the players. For example, if your controlled gate gets eradicated, you earn an Elder Sign. For each unit that is eradicated, you earn 1 Power. The Power gain may not be enough to make up for losing a big monster or Great Old One, but at least it helps.

And, after all, the destruction has been telegraphed by the presence of a Worm – so you had your chance to escape!

The Shaggai map has other fun elements. For example, you can “jump over” Eradicated areas, and thus access the map more easily. This does cost a unit though, so be sure to include someone cheap to sacrifice to the hungry void. Also, if the map deteriorates too far, the game can end regardless of whether anyone has 30 Doom yet. In such a case, all players add up their Doom and Elder Signs and see who is victorious.

—description from the publisher

The Worm of Ghroth sculpt is credited to "Tidal 4".

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Six to Eight Player Shaggai Map
Description: An expansion map for Cthulhu Wars. This is a 6-8 player version of the regular Shaggai Map, and follows the same special rules of play.

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Beyond Time and Space
Description:
More monsters and terror!

Components:


     4 Wamp Miniatures
     2 Voonith Miniatures
     Hound of Tindalos figure
     3 Loyalty Cards


Vooniths are an “amphibious horror” referenced by Lovecraft in his tale, The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath. Pretty much nothing else is known of them. The design of the Voonith upon sirens and amphisboenas – these are existing amphibians & reptiles who only have forelegs. So the back half of the Voonith is long & eel-like, while the front part has claws and fangs. The model shows it rearing up, ready to strike. They cost 3 Power, and only have 1 Combat, which may at first seem puny, but wait, there’s more!

The Voonith is a solitary hunter, and I wanted the in-game version to foster that concept. Therefore, its special ability is that if you roll NO kills in a battle involving your Voonith, add 1 kill to your total. Because of this, the Voonith’s 1 combat die isn’t actually a drawback. If you have 2 Vooniths and roll no kills, you’d get 2 kills for free. And yes, if you have 2 Vooniths in Battle and roll only 1 kill, you get a free kill for your deficit. Basically, each Voonith you have provides a guaranteed kill!

—description from the publisher

The Hound of Tindalos, Wamp, and Voonith sculpts are credited to "Tidal 4".

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Masks of Nyarlathotep
Description:
The multiplicity of the Crawling Chaos!

Components:

     9 Dark Demon Miniatures
     9 Loyalty cards
     2 Spellbooks
     The Shadow Pharaoh figure
     The Bloated Woman figure
     Haunter of the Dark figure


The Dark Demons 
The dark demon is a form of Nyarlathotep which manifests itself by literally engulfing and transforming his summoner. When the avatar departs, the victim’s body is left transformed, forever a hideous monster. In the box, we provide Dark Demons in every faction color: nine total figures! When you recruit the Dark Demon, all the enemy factions also get one, but theirs is a burden and weakness to them, while yours is more of an asset.

The Shadow Pharaoh 
This manifestation is Nyarlathotep’s Egyptian connection, well-known from many stories. The figure itself is a sort of combination of sphinx, scorpion, mummy, pharaoh, and tentacled horror. I really like it, and I think you will too. It has an especially nasty ability which drives cultists off gates, making the gates vulnerable to be captured once the Pharaoh leaves.

The Bloated Woman
First popularized in the well-known adventure Masks of Nyarlathotep for the Call of Cthulhu system, the Bloated Woman is Nyarlathotep in a rather repulsive female form. She steals killed enemies, and later transforms your gates so they produce Elder Signs rather than Power.

The Haunter of the Dark
The Haunter of the Dark is a full-on Great Old One. It is awakened as with most independent Great Old Ones – you need a Gate with your own Great Old One. In the Haunter’s case, you spend 6 Power to get the loyalty card, putting it in the same high-end category as game-changers such as Atlach-Nacha, Cthugha, or Daoloth. (Most Independent Great Old Ones only cost 4, or even 2.)

If you’re Crawling Chaos, you can awaken the Haunter for just 5 Power, and you don’t need a Great Old One, so obtaining it is a lot easier, BUT every other faction does get an Elder Sign when you do this.

The Haunter is explicitly a combat critter. It has a combat of 1 per enemy spellbook (so in theory 0-6, but in practice usually at the high end). I wanted to reflect the fact that one of the Haunter’s best-known characteristics is that it can’t survive well in the light. Therefore, it actually starts with a weakness, representing this disability – Fly The Light. This “ability” states that post-Battle, if the enemy scored only 1 Kill, it MUST be applied to the Haunter. If the enemy scored 2 or more kills though, you can target them normally.

The Haunter’s spellbook is really easy to get – just spend 1 Power as an action. Trivial. In fact, normally this is the first thing you’ll do after awakening the Haunter, which gives your enemies a one-turn window to try to take it out, before you get this frightful pre-Battle ability. It’s The Shining Trapezohedron. Before rolling combat dice, your enemy has to roll 1 die per unit he has in the battle. For each Kill he rolls, he must eliminate a unit (his choice).

—description from the publisher

The Bloated Woman, Shadow Pharaoh, Dark Demon, and Haunter of the Dark sculpts are credited to "Tidal 4".

Name: Evolution: Last Stand
Description:
Promo card for pre-order Russian copy of Evolution: Flight on the Boomstarter
It is also part of Promo pack II.

"Last Stand" Event Card
Play this card when a Carnivore attacks one of your species. The Carnivore loses a Population instead of your species. Draw a card.

Name: Evolution: Claws
Description:
Promo card for pre-order Russian copy of Evolution: Flight on the Boomstarter

"Claws"
Play this card on your ground Predator during the card draw phase after opening the card properties.
The predator immediately attacks, ignoring one protective property of the victim.
Take a new card.

Name: Dungeon Time: Velara Doran Promo Card
Description: The Velara Doran Promo Card allows you to remove an active hero from the game in order to exchange any number of items from your backpack with the discard pile and vice versa.

Name: Dungeon Time: Zulkro Schädelsang Promo Card
Description: The Zulko Schädelsang Promo Card allows you to remove a hero from another player from the game and randomly draw three hero currently not used. Give one of them to the player whose hero you discarded.

Name: Chessaga
Description:
CHESSaga is a fantasy/chess game where players take their chess pieces on story-driven journeys across custom game-maps!

The hero player controls 3 chess pieces -- a knight, a bishop, and a rook. On each map, they face 1 or more enemy pieces, controlled by the villain player.  An losses the hero incurs are permanent.  On the first 6 maps, the goal is to rescue the captured pawn(s) then escape the board via a specified exit square. On those boards, the pawns are stationary objects. Defeating the enemy piece(s) is not necessary.  On the final board, the pawns activate and join the hero to help them capture the enemy king.  If the hero players makes it through all 7 boards and capture the enemy king, they win.  Otherwise, the villain wins.

With more than 2 players, players split control of the hero pieces.  The rulebook also provides loose guidelines for playing solo and controlling both sides fairly.

The gameboards and rules are all contained in a thin comic-book sized booklet that opens up to different pages for different missions.

Name: Avignon: Schism
Description:
A strategic new way to experience Avignon.

Avignon: Schism is a 7-card expansion to Avignon adding a new strategic layer. Using the cards from the base game and any or all expansions, players will create their own combination of characters and move a faction card back and forth.

Also included is Mass, which is a new action that can be played with or without Schism.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Avignon – A Clash of Popes

Name: Road Hog: Rule the Road – Road Rage promo card expansion
Description: Four card promotion expansion to Road Rage. This pack includes one red, blue, green, and yellow card each. The promo packs were distributed at BGG.Con 2017 and a fifth packing card specifies copy number out of 75.

Name: The Zombie, The Princess & The Kid Next Door
Description:
It's the game that features a surprising mix of characters, amazingly simple rules and the right touch of cleverness.

Each player starts with 3 tiles.  On every turn place one of your tiles on any open space on the board.  But look carefully so you don't place a tile that will help your opponents score as you try to get three in a row - vertically, horizontally or diagonally.

When you're successful, collect a token.  On some especially good moves you can get 2 or 3 tokens.  
At the end of the game when the board is full of zombies, princesses and that kid next door, the player with the most tokens wins.

Name: Secrets of the Lost Tomb: Promo 1
Description: Promo 1 includes Vampirella & Adam Van Helsing for new player characters. As with the Fate's Fortune expansion, both these new characters have ascended forms with some unique weapons printed on the ascended sides.
Families: Game: Secrets of the Lost Tomb

Name: Perjuangan Jomblo
Description:
Perjuangan Jomblo ("Singles Struggles") is an Indonesian-designed board game, portraying the struggles of men and women in Indonesia finding the love of their life.

Perjuangan Jomblo finished on the third place of Kompas Board Game Challange 2015, behind Waroong Wars and Pagelarang Yogyakarta as first and second place respectively.

The goal of the game is to achieve a set number of victory points by making a move to a set of men/women with different needs. Each round, players are taking turn in selecting a man or woman to make a move to. They fulfill the needs of their target by playing cards from their hands. Afterwards, there is an added push your luck element by guessing the required "cool" or "handsome" factor from the randomizer deck. IF they are successful, some VP is awarded, and the target goes up to the next level (more needy), making them harder to be approached next time. The empty slot below him/her is then filled with a new one at the end of the round.

The game also features a little bit of take-that mechanism to ruin other player's relationship.

—user summary

Wahai Pejuang Cinta !!!
Kini tiba saatnya untukmu maju bertempur di medan cinta. Berjuanglah untuk mengejar pujaan hatimu demi mendapatkan cinta mereka. Ini bukanlah pertarungan yang sepele, ini akan keras! Penuh intrik dan perjuangan.

Mampukah kamu lulus dari gelar Jomblo ? Tunjukan perjuangan cintamu dalam board game Perjuangan Jomblo.

—description from publisher

Name: Star Command
Description:
Tactical Space Combat - 22nd Century

Star Command brings the future to you!

Star Command is the tactical game of space combat in the 22nd century between the Terran Federation and the felinoid Shaanthra. Designed with both board gamers and miniature gamers in mind, Star Command uses simultaneous movement and fire featuring laser and missile weapons in starships using gravitic drives and hyperdrives for faster than light movement. Rules are included for strategic play and spacecraft markers are provided so that you may begin to enjoy the game immediately without buying expensive models. Additional rules for three-dimensional play.
—description from the publisher

Set in the same fictional universe as Kurtick's Strike Team Alpha.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Realm of Desires
Description:
Realm of Desires is a strategic turn-based board game for 2-4 players set in a fantasy medieval era where an epic war happen due to the clash between 4 races over their desires.

No Dice, No Luck. Your strategy can overcome any obstacle and turn any potential disadvantage to an advantage in this game.

Modular battlefield will make each game unique and filled with its challenges to command and conquer the other races.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Apocalypse
Description:
"Enemy colors are banding together like never before. All creatures show signs of the Apocalypse, as new magical abilities threaten to unleash multicolored mayhem. If you’re wise and learn how to wield their fury, their cataclysmic power could be your own.

This 143-card set features a host of new mechanics and multicolored madness: Envoys, Siphon Creatures, Enemy Pain Lands, Enemy Split Cards, Disciples, Volvers, and Sanctuaries."

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Odyssey
Description:
Take a 100-year leap forward to a harsh Dominaria, where deadly pit fighting is the new world order. Odyssey features new mechanics designed to harness the power of your graveyard. It also marks the beginning of a new trilogy, with all-new races and locales.

This 350-card, black-bordered set includes randomly inserted foil premium cards and two new graveyard-based mechanics: Flashback and Threshold.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Torment
Description:
Centered around the Cabal's Dementia Summoners, Torment introduces new Madness and Nightmare mechanics designed to drive your opponents utterly insane. Wield such dark power as the Faceless Butcher and Sengir Vampire in this blackest of black sets.

This 143-card set includes two new game mechanics (Madness and Nightmares) as well as additional cards for the Flashback and Threshold mechanics of Odyssey.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dragonfire: Hidden Treasures
Description: Hidden Treasures contains 52 Magic Items specifically for use by retailers for their Dungeons & Dragons Dragonfire community. Whenever players successfully complete an Adventure in your store, they can draw items from this deck, most of which cannot be found anywhere else. Unleash new magic armor, swords, scrolls, and other hidden secrets that will build any character's legend!

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Judgment
Description:
Deep within the Krosan Forest, the final showdown for the Mirari begins. The forces of white and green ascend to counter the black dominance of Torment. Plus, five powerful Wish cards allow you to seek any card you own and put it into your hand—a Magic player’s dream.

This 143-card, black-bordered set includes the powerful new Wish mechanic, intriguing new creatures, and an old friend: Erhnam Djinn.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Onslaught
Description:
Take on the Cabal and a fearsome new master illusionist. In Onslaught, Creature Types—Clerics, Soldiers, Birds, Wizards, Zombies, Goblins, Beasts, Elves, and Illusions—define the world of Magic like never before.

This black-bordered, 350-card set features randomly inserted foil premium cards and powerful mechanics like Morph, “Creature Types Matter” Cards, Fear, Chain Spells, and Cycling (an old favorite from Urza's Saga).

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Legions
Description:
The master illusionist Ixidor is banished, but the magic of the Mirari continues to mutate all life on Otaria. In the midst of this turmoil, Phage and Akroma draw armies to their sides. Thus, the Legions are born. And it’s time for war.

Legions is a 145-card, creature-only set with randomly inserted foil-finished premium cards. But with creatures that have abilities like Provoke, Amplify, Morph, and Slivers, who needs spells?

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Scourge
Description:
Ancient, unseen forces have fused two immensely powerful archenemies into one: Karona, avatar of war. That’s why everything is on a grander scale in Scourge, with some of the biggest, jaw-dropping Creatures ever featured in one set.

This 143-card set includes randomly inserted foil-finished premium cards and new mechanics like Storm, Landcycling, Warchiefs, and even a few creatures that morph for free.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering –  Mirrodin
Description:
In a distant corner of the Multiverse lies Mirrodin, a plane made entirely of metal. Discover a new Magic story with new characters and new Equipment cards, all set in an artifact-rich environment.

This 306-card, black-bordered set introduces several new mechanics to Magic (Imprint, Affinity, and Entwine) as well as the new Equipment card type, adding power and reusability to your deck.

'—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Darksteel
Description:
It’s everything you loved about Mirrodin and more: more Equipment, more artifacts, and more abilities. Throw in the first indestructible artifacts, too, and it packs a memorable punch.

This 165-card deck introduces two new abilities to the Mirrodin block: Indestructible and Modular.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Fifth Dawn
Description:
Fifth Dawn journeys deep inside the plane’s core to take the Mirrodin block out with a bang: bigger creatures, faster Equipment, and more reasons to play all five colors. Throw in card combos guaranteed to obliterate and you get a set you have to play to believe.

The Fifth Dawn expansion includes 165 black-bordered cards and introduces two new abilities to the Mirrodin block: Sunburst and Scry.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Champions of Kamigawa
Description:
Clouds of bizarre creatures attack samurai in their sleep. Goblins flee from angry ice spirits. At the Minamo School, students of wizardry fight nonstop to stem a flow of materializing beings. Kamigawa is at war—humans against spirits.

Champions of Kamigawa introduces several new mechanics (Bushido, Flip Cards, Soulshift, and Splice onto Arcane) as well as the first Legendary Enchantments and more Legendary creatures than any previous set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Betrayers of Kamigawa
Description:
As the spirit war raged on Kamigawa, those close to the daimyo Konda began to fear for his sanity. His isolation drove his willful daughter Michiko away to seek the truth about the war. To make matters worse, an unimaginably powerful kami, the O-Kagachi, had begun to manifest in the material world, devouring Kamigawa piece by piece.

Turn the tables on your opponents with Ninja, Patrons, and Genju—yes, even the land gets into the act!

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Saviors of Kamigawa
Description:
Konda's crime against the kami is revealed: He stole a living spirit. The abductee wasn't just any kami, either. It was a guardian of the boundary between the material and spirit worlds. As the war rises to a fever pitch, fueled by Konda’s pride and the kami’s fury, the veil between the material world and the spirit world is torn to tatters. Could Kamigawa's last hope for peace be the daimyo's sole heir?

The Kami War comes to a head with a bang. Take down your opponent with powerful new “hand size matters” cards and Epic spells.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Finest Guild Of Real Gentleorcs
Description:
Insulting at the highest level!

Have you always wanted to fool the elves, witches, orcs and magicians of their unconstructive mindset? Use your non-existent tact and inexhaustible creativity to verbally humiliate your companions as efficiently as possible. With each new game, new unique combinations of insults are created that you can hand out to your comrades. But beware, because your companions also have some quick-witted insults that they would love to hand over to you.

The game is being played by players drafting cards from a common pool, creating their humiliation as a phrase. A grammatically correct sentence, no matter if it makes sense or not, can be used against an opponent to shame him publically, giving him penalty points. Some races are offended and thus humilated more by specific words than others. Once a player has accumulated 30 points or more through insults of the other players, he is eliminated from the game, though there are a couple of proposed house rule which allow for different ways to play this game.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Ravnica: City of Guilds
Description:
Ravnica is one vast megalopolis—a patchwork of grand halls, decrepit slums, and ancient ruins. Of the world's countless civic centers, one looms above all: the City of Ravnica, where the world’s guilds vie for power and control. Which guild will you choose?

This 306-card set features four of the Ravnica guilds: Boros Legion (red-white), House Dimir (black-blue), Golgari Swarm (black-green), and Selesnya Conclave (green-white).

—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Guildpact
Description:
